Articles.Content:
Hello I have a new G-sync enabled monitor and to enable it one has to run a game in true full screen. When I enabled the full screen in the graphics tab of KSP it simply sets it borderless full screen. Is there a way to force it to lock into proper true full screen rather it be a INI edit or some option I have simply overlooked?

Thank you in advance for any assistance's. Google sadly didn't return any situation quite like what I have.

The full screen option in the menu shouldn't be making it go to borderless window mode. So there must be something else interfering. Avoid running KSP from the launcher, run directly from KSP.exe instead. Also make sure you aren't using the -popupwindow command line argument.

Just launched from within the game directory and still borderless full screen mode at main menu as well as ingame. Now I do have two monitors. One running at 2560x1440 and the other at 1920x1200 not sure if that affects it.
You can try running it with the -adapter N command in that case; N should be the number (I think they start at 0) of the monitor you want it to run on.

Ok so plugged in the -adapter 0,1 & 2 into the Set Launch Options and never manually switched it to the 1920x1200 screen, always booted into the 1440p one. I can still pull the mouse off and click onto the second screen but when I do it now it does mememize the game but music still plays and G-sync is still sadly not kicking in.

Hmm. Well, the fact that it's minimising when you click off the screen it's active in usually indicates in it's true fullscreen mode -- in fact, that's often reported as one of the most annoying troubles with trying to get KSP running smoothly on a multi-monitor setup. Not sure why the G-sync thing is not kicking in, though.

From what I can see on the interwebs, G-Sync is a technology that requires you to have both a monitor and graphics adapter that support it. Maybe that's it? (List of system requirements.)
Sadly not. I tested to ensure that G-sync was working in Elder Scrolls V and it kicked on smoothly so I do know it is kicking on with my GTX 660.

I am also experiencing this issue. I have a GSYNC monitor and a supported video card. Running the game in full screen does not kick in GSYNC. I think this may be a problem with Unity games because the same behavior with Hearthstone. Other games that run in full screen, like Team Fortress 2, GSYNC works fine with.
It also doesn't work in Wasteland 2, which is a Unity engine game.
